p: Possible modes of antibacterial action of some of the secondary metabolites could be described as follows: Tannins may act by inactivating microbial adhesins, enzymes and cell envelope transport proteins [ 34]; flavonoids by altering the cell membranes of microbes and inhibiting energy metabolism and synthesis of nucleic acids [ 36], alkaloids by disrupting the cell wall and /or inhibiting Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) synthesis (Ref?); anthraquinones by increasing the levels of superoxide anions and/or singlet oxygen molecules [ 37], and diterpenes and phenolic compounds by disrupting microbial cell membranes [ 38].
